title: Start-ups set out to make coffee more sustainable - Financial Times
summary: The article discusses innovative uses of coffee waste in construction and product creation, highlighting companies like Woodpecker, which turns coffee husks into building materials, and Kaffeeform, which makes reusable cups from coffee grounds. As coffee consumption rises, these companies aim to address environmental challenges associated with the industry, such as waste management and sustainability. Additionally, the article notes the economic pressures faced by coffee producers and emphasizes circular economy efforts in the coffee sector. Overall, it showcases various approaches to transforming coffee waste into valuable resources while advocating for sustainable practices.
green_innovation: TRUE - This is green innovation as it involves creating products and processes that significantly reduce environmental waste and improve sustainability in the coffee industry.
business_innovation: TRUE - This is a business innovation because it introduces new and improved products and processes that are distinct from the companies' previous offerings, aiming to optimize waste and resources.
green_product: TRUE - The building materials made from coffee husks and the reusable cups made from coffee grounds are considered green products as they are designed to minimize environmental impact and promote sustainability.
green_process: TRUE - The methods used by Woodpecker and Kaffeeform to recycle coffee waste into usable products constitute green processes, as they minimize waste and promote resource conservation.
likely_naics_codes: Likely NAICS Codes: 321911 - Wood Container and Pallet Manufacturing, 326199 - All Other Plastics Product Manufacturing, 339999 - All Other Miscellaneous Manufacturing, 541620 - Environmental Consulting Services
greenwashing: FALSE - The article does not depict greenwashing; it presents genuine innovations aimed at reducing waste in the coffee industry and improving sustainability practices.

title: ESGL Holdings Limited (NASDAQ: ESGL) Announces Multi-Year Contract Renewal with Singapore Refining Company ... - GlobeNewswire
summary: Environmental Solutions Group Holdings Limited announced the renewal of a multi-year contract with Singapore Refining Company for used catalyst waste disposal services. The partnership emphasizes the company's commitment to sustainable waste management and circular economy solutions. The contract extends until December 31, 2025, and reflects the company's strategy and long-term potential in collaboration with key partners. ESGL is focused on innovative technology to transform waste while preserving the environment.
green_innovation: TRUE, because the company's work in providing used catalyst waste disposal services contributes to sustainable waste management and supports the circular economy, thereby reducing negative environmental impacts.
business_innovation: TRUE, because the renewal of the contract for waste disposal services represents a new or improved business process that significantly differs from the previous business operations of ESGL.
green_product: FALSE, because the article does not describe a specific product that fits the definition of a green product, as it focuses on waste disposal services rather than a tangible good.
green_process: TRUE, because the waste disposal services provided by ESGL minimize environmental impacts and promote sustainability, aligning with the definition of a green process.
likely_naics_codes: Likely NAICS Codes: 562910 - Remediation Services; 562211 - Hazardous Waste Treatment and Disposal; 562112 - Hazardous Waste Collection; 325188 - All Other Chemical Manufacturing.
greenwashing: FALSE, because the article provides factual information about a legitimate contract renewal for waste disposal services focused on sustainability and does not suggest any misleading environmental claims.

title: Reboxed® secures £1.6 million Seed investment led by ACF Investors - UK Tech Investment News
summary: Reboxed®, a sustainable tech startup, has secured £1.6 million in seed funding to help tackle the e-waste crisis by providing out-of-the-box recommerce solutions for retailers and businesses. The company aims to rehome 100 million electronic devices by 2030 and offers premium refurbished technology products, enhancing sustainability in consumer electronics. With a growing interest in refurbished products, Reboxed® is positioned as a leader in advancing the circular economy within the tech sector. CEO Phil Kemish highlighted the importance of providing high-quality tech with an integrated approach to sustainability.
green_innovation: TRUE - The company focuses on rehoming electronic devices through a recommerce model, which reduces e-waste and supports sustainability goals by promoting the circular economy.
business_innovation: TRUE - Reboxed® is a new business model that significantly differs from traditional retail practices by offering refurbished and pre-owned tech products, thus innovating in the recommerce sector.
green_product: TRUE - The refurbished devices offered by Reboxed® are designed to reduce environmental impact, utilize sustainable practices, and support recycling efforts.
green_process: TRUE - Reboxed® employs a recommerce process that minimizes waste, conserves resources, and reduces energy consumption through sustainable technology solutions.

greenwashing: FALSE - The article presents a genuine commitment to sustainability through the promotion of refurbished devices and aims to address the e-waste crisis, indicating that Reboxed® is not engaging in greenwashing.
